author: marvin
msg: It's a "qualified identifier" because it includes a qualified namespace path.

author: marvin
msg: Bottom-up parsers such as the LALR(1) parsers built with Lemon or YACC have
more difficulty resolving grammar ambiguities than recursive descent parsers,
because they operate with less context.  Unless we want to restrict IDENTIFIER
so that it can never be part of a class name (for instance by making it all
lower case), we end up with conflicts where it is not clear how a token should
be reduced.  Therefore we should tolerate class names and object type names
which are invalid according to the rules of Clownfish at the parser grammar
level, but catch the invalid names later at object construction time.

author: minfrin
msg: Backport to apr-util v1.5 from apr-trunk:
apr_crypto: Replace the LDAP inspired constant-based parameter passing with
the apr_dbd inspired string passing, and simplify configuration.

msg: Updated maven resolver arquillian artifacts to 1.0.0-beta-5 to match Arquillian showcase

author: rjung
msg: BZ 51769: IIS: Allow URIs which contain "META-INF" or
"WEB-INF" as long as they are not path components of the URI.
I kept the old stristr function, because it
could be useful for something else.
